intro: Leucadendron rugosum, commonly known as the silver tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Proteaceae family native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silver-gray, fuzzy foliage and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The plant produces striking, cone-like inflorescences that range in color from yellow to red, depending on the variety. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Leucadendron rugosum is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
